title: Drawing, "Design for a Cup", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, white chalk, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: In black ink at upper right: 377
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: "VASE;" at lower right: "JEAN PUIFORCAT/45.;" at center right: - "FIL TORSADE [twisted bands]."
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Wide bowl raised on a tall base decorated with two twisted coiled springs. Inscription "Fil Torsade" to the right of top coiled spring. Underdrawing in graphite of vase in golden section.
Fabricated vase in the collections of the Musee des Arts Decoratifs, Paris (Inv. 36047) and Jean Puiforcat's daughter, Catalina de la Nove, Vinevil St. Fermin, France.
Puiforcat collection contains archival photograph, Box 9, Folder 19, "Vases" # 9470.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 9470.
